thread.title: Digitaldowns.us Announces Season 32 Virtual Horse Racing Triple Crown Series

author: cbs8
title: Digitaldowns.us Announces Season 32 Virtual Horse Racing Triple Crown Series
text:
digitaldowns.us
A Three Race Series of Ascending Distances to Determine a Champion at Each Distance
MIDLAND, Texas , Oct. 26, Beginning this weekend 10/25/2015 digitaldowns.us an online skills-based virtual horse racing site announces its Season 32 Triple Crown Series . The series is split into two divisions, one for 3 year-old male horses and one for 3 year-old female horses. The series for males consists of the Secretariat Derby, Citation Stakes, and the Seattle Slew Derby. The female division consists of the Bouquet Stakes, Pink Diamond Stakes, and the Red Rose Oaks. The series was created to determine each season's best horse for each distance in the series. Members of the site who nominate their virtual horses in the series, race against other members for lucrative purse monies and supplemental monies added by digitaldowns.us.
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151026/PH38094-a
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151026/PH38094-b
"This season the Triple Crown Series is the most competitive and exciting as ever before!" explained digitaldowns race article writer Jason Zeber . "The Triple Crown is the marquee event on every member's calendar. Winning a race in the series is considered one of the greatest accomplishments for a member's training career."
Each leg of the series is supplemented by digitaldowns with a starting purse amount, then added to the nomination fees to comprise the total purse of the race. This season digitaldowns.us is offering a $300 bonus for any member whose horse is able to win all three races of their division and sweep the Triple Crown series. During the series, all members can participate in free handicapping contests for fun and rewarding prizes. Recent enhancements to the site and the influx of new members is expected to continue giving the Triple Crown series a more challenging and rewarding experience.
If you would like more information about this topic, please contact Freddie Arballo or Bob Takakjy at 432-349-4302 or email .
